title: How to Construct an Octagon with a Compass

steps.title: Gather your materials and set up your work space.
steps.content: Gather your materials and set up your work space. You will need: A mechanical compass with pencil A pencil eraser A ruler A spare pencil (recommended)

steps.title: Make the line 9 inches long.
steps.content: Make the line 9 inches long. For best results, use light pencil markings.

steps.title: Mark the midpoint and call it "A."
steps.content: Mark the midpoint and call it "A." This will be the center of your octagon.

steps.title: Measure the width of the pencil tip and the compass needle.
steps.content: Measure the width of the pencil tip and the compass needle. Adjust it to 3 inches.

steps.title: Twist the compass handle to create a circle as shown.
steps.content: Twist the compass handle to create a circle as shown. Be careful since the compass needle is sharp.

steps.title: Label the first point on the left end "B."
steps.content: Label the first point on the left end "B." Label the second point on the right "C."

steps.title: Call the uppermost intersection point "D" and the lowermost point "E."
steps.content: Call the uppermost intersection point "D" and the lowermost point "E."

steps.title: Use a pencil and ruler to draw the vertical line.
steps.content: Use a pencil and ruler to draw the vertical line.

steps.title: Label the intersection between F and E point "H".
steps.content: Label the intersection between F and E point "H". Then, place the ruler across the circle, lining it up next to points A and H.

steps.title: Make the diameter intersect the circle at 2 different points.
steps.content: Make the diameter intersect the circle at 2 different points.

steps.title: Draw a diameter containing points A and G.
steps.content: Draw a diameter containing points A and G. Make sure the line intersects the circle at 2 more points. Label the 2 new intersections as follows. The upper right most intersection should be called point K. The lower left most intersection should be called point L.

steps.title: These points are near the upper left of the circle.
steps.content: These points are near the upper left of the circle.

steps.title: Repeat this step with the following points:
steps.content: Repeat this step with the following points: Points I and M, creating line segment IM Points M and K, creating line segment MK Points K and C, creating line segment KC Points C and J, creating line segment CJ Points J and N, creating line segment JN Points N and L, creating line segment NL Finally points L and B, creating line segment LB

steps.title: Your octagon should now look like this.
steps.content: Your octagon should now look like this. You have successfully created an octagon using a compass and a straightedge. As you can see, this is why its better to use light marks. Otherwise, your drawing may have this hard-to-erase marks left over.
